page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT-TRANSPORT.Headcor
page.content: In this part of{Headcorn}many people work on the land.Some work in the village,others travel to jobs in near- by towns or commute to{London}by rail. There are also a number of retired people living here.Being a rural area, most families have some form of trans- port of their own,so the country roads are well used.Children go to school in other areas;some are collected by Mini Bus,older children bus to{Maidstone,or go to{Ashford}by train. This means a walk or ride to{Headcorn Station}where there is a frequent service between {Ashford}and{London;}or to the{A274main {road}where buses serve the villages between{Tenterden and Maidstone.}There is also a limited bus service twice a week in to Maidstone, for Pensioners only.
